name: Lauren Behel
text: I had a great experience! I’m submitting my review a couple weeks late (sorry). But— I had gotten my phone screen “fixed” at a rival store (the one in the mall), and they failed to install my screen correctly.... twice. And left my battery loose in the phone so that it was not glued down as it originally was to the inside. They also failed to glue in and screw in my new screen properly. I walked into this other store with a lose screw clanging around in the phone. So. I came here, to the Cell Phone Doctor to have it PROPERLY fixed, based on reviews I had seen. I made a great choice. He immediately told me what they had done wrong, fixed the battery issue with no extra charge, and was nothing but kind and fast at his work. A real expert. I had no issues, he was very respectful and easy to deal with, and a few weeks out I’ve had no issues! So I suppose it’s good that I’m late to reviewing, as I can see that it is still holding up perfectly! Thank you!!!

name: Catherine Kloess
text: I love Cellairis and have used them twice previously. The cool part is that they protect the screen so that it doesn't break again with a cover that is not likely to break. This location is the exception. I just wanted to buy the screen over the phone and have it shipped so that I could travel only once to the store. This store is a bit of a journey for me.  They would not under any circumstance take a credit card over the phone and do this for the customer that is in Cellairis' customer data base. I am so visible on the internet. It makes me wonder if perhaps they had an employee who took customer information and used it for something nefarious. The idea that they could not take payment over the phone is odd in this day and age. I simply found them to be adversarial and not interested in one more customer. Every other Cellairis I have ever been to was completely amazing. If this is the worse thing that happens to me I will be just fine. I would not recommend this location to anyone and would advise you to consider what type of people own and operate a location that would behave this way.

resp.text:
Sorry for the experience Catherine,
However I would like to announce this to you that the ownership and management for this location has changed and we do accept online payments now.

name: bre me
text:
TLDR: Shyna and Rachel are amazing at their jobs and fixing a bad day, and I definitely would (and will) come here again for other repairs. Also, their selection of cases is massive and full of variety. Call them about estimates and such.

3 hours ago, the phone I am typing this on wouldn't turn on and the screen was cracked badly after a very bad day. By the time I got off work, it was 7:45, and all other phone repair shops in town were closed. It's Veterans Day weekend which means a lot of places are closed for the next day or two. Thank god Cellairis was open. I called and asked for an estimate before going and asked about a student discount and screen protector. Shyna gave me an incredible deal for calling that made this struggling college student feel sooooooo much better. And when there was confusion between what Shyna told me on the phone and what I was told in one store (since there are two locations in the mall, Shyna's deal was honored!! One of the things they test for after fixing a phone wasn't met when I came to pick up my phone, and Shyna worked on my phone well past their closing hours and tested it until it met their standards. Rachel stayed to help out as well and make sure everything went well and I was satisfied. They both were very kind, and they both were so very helpful! They also talked to me like a normal person and explained what they were doing when I asked, and they were very friendly. It's been a while since I have had service that nice! Thank you both so much!

Brenna

text:
Tuesday, May 24 I took my shattered iPhone 6 to one of your locations in Bel Air Mall to be serviced. Specifically, I was at the kiosk located across from Victoria's Secret, and Ryan was working. He did an excellent job replacing my phone screen as well as talking with me throughout the process while we established mutual connections and potential endeavors. Even when I discovered a small issue after I left the mall, Ryan made every effort to rectify the problem. The issue with the phone was pre-existing, but he treated it as if it had happened in-store as he diligently worked to get my phone back to normal in the quickest possible time. Ryan made an inauspicious event turn into a pleasurable experience.

If you have any malfunctions with your phone or need a new case, Cellairis should be the first place you go.

name: bre me
text:
TLDR: Shyna and Rachel are amazing at their jobs and fixing a bad day, and I definitely would (and will) come here again for other repairs. Also, their selection of cases is massive and full of variety. Call them about estimates and such.

3 hours ago, the phone I am typing this on wouldn't turn on and the screen was cracked badly after a very bad day. By the time I got off work, it was 7:45, and all other phone repair shops in town were closed. It's Veterans Day weekend which means a lot of places are closed for the next day or two. Thank god Cellairis was open. I called and asked for an estimate before going and asked about a student discount and screen protector. Shyna gave me an incredible deal for calling that made this struggling college student feel sooooooo much better. And when there was confusion between what Shyna told me on the phone and what I was told in one store (since there are two locations in the mall, Shyna's deal was honored!! One of the things they test for after fixing a phone wasn't met when I came to pick up my phone, and Shyna worked on my phone well past their closing hours and tested it until it met their standards. Rachel stayed to help out as well and make sure everything went well and I was satisfied. They both were very kind, and they both were so very helpful! They also talked to me like a normal person and explained what they were doing when I asked, and they were very friendly. It's been a while since I have had service that nice! Thank you both so much!

Brenna

text:

I called this location last month to ask and the person on the phone told me he canceled it right then and there. Today I got charged again for In and Out.

He offered to refund my money which I was appreciative of. He then proceeded to put the old screen back on the phone and now the entire phone won’t work.  The only thing it will do is display an apple logo. I told the guy- and he apologized, but offered no assistance in getting the phone to the working conditions that I dropped it off in.  This phone is less than 4months old.

name: Evita B
text:
My husband cracked the screen of my Note 8 by accident and I didn't want to replace it. Found this place and decided to give it a try. They had to order my screen and we paid in advance. Asked about insurance, which we don't have on my phone because I've never broken any of my phones. The guy at the counter kept commenting on how expensive it was going to be.... okay, so?... I want my phone fixed and your business does this right...?

We paid and were told it would take 3 to 5 days for the screen to come in; they would call me and I could come in and have the phone's screen replaced in an hour or so. 10 days pass and no one calls me. My husband calls them and they say the screen is in and I can come in and get it replaced. They then try to call me, but I was unavailable. The next day, he drops the phone off as soon as they open at 10am, and was informed that the only one who could fix it wasn't there yet. He would be there in 45mins and it would take 2hrs to fix the screen. 2 hrs....

My husband decided to go to the gym, then come home and clean up. He called them at 2pm and my phone was still being worked on: they said give him more time. He arrived there after 3:30pm and the phone was not finished being repaired. Decided to pick up dinner next door. Still not done. So finally, around 4pm it is finished. It works and has a lifetime warranty for the pressure sensitivity. This was one thing I was concerned about: the screen's pressure sensitivity.

I get my phone and inspect it. It was not even sealed properly! Therefore, it is not waterproof anymore, and not resellable. Annoyed, I go to the shop myself and the tech who worked on my phone is very apologetic, admits it was done incorrectly, but is unable to help me. He said he was busy and trying to hurry because my husband had been waiting for a while. Still has a lot of things to work on; I could leave it overnight, come by tomorrow. Maybe it would get done. I can't leave my phone there overnight, and I can't come back the next day. He was going to try and put weight on the phone before taking the screen off and resealing it.

That is what I'm trying to do now: put weight on it. I wrapped it in screen cleaning cloths and set a gallon water jug on it. About 7 or 8 lbs. I asked him how much weight, but he never answered me, telling me instead about the warranty. The warranty is for the screen's pressure sensitivity.

I'd rather have it take a long time and done correctly, than rushed and crappy. Now, I'm trying to correctly their mistake. I don't think pressing it down with weight will help. It is misaligned somewhere, and not glued and seal properly.

Paid $340 to have my phone's screen replaced and they didn't do it properly. The back part is spongy; you press down and it comes back up. The whole left side was not placed correctly or glued down properly. Would never go here again. And would urge everyone to not waste their time until the people at CPR have better organization and attention to detail. They also seem like they need more knowledgeable people. My husband was told this tech had never worked on a Samsung Note 8 and that one of them only works on computers and laptops; no phones at all. Cell Phone Repair.

resp.text: It sounds like you love the Note 8 and we do too. Please return the device to the store so we can help out.

name: Kyle H
text: I went in trying to get my charging port repaired and was told they would have to destroy the screen and the repair would be over $200. I was advised instead to purchase a wireless charger elsewhere and a battery from them since mine was weak. I did buy the battery from them and they came from the back with a battery that had no seal or package and sold it to me for $40 and took my old battery, which it would not charge past 20% until I bought a new battery from another location indicating they sold me a used battery as new. What they didn't inform me was that my phone was not wireless charging capable. I went back to try and get a refund but I was never given a receipt and they said they can't do anything about it since they have no records of them selling it to me. Not only am I now stuck with a used battery that was sold as a new but was given false information. I took my business to another phone repair shop that was capable of performing my repair at $65 compared to their quoted $200 and my screen never had to be shattered. I advise not conducting any business with this store if you need anything because you may end up with used parts and misleading information.

resp.text:
Hi Kyle, I wish you would have contacted us directly regarding this. We would have been happy to explain why this is the way that it is.

The repair shop that you brought your device to has the capability of micro soldering a new charging port to the existing cable. We do not have that capability which means that we must remove the entire flex cable to change the port. The problem with that is the navigation buttons that are on the phone are sealed under the screen and wrap around to the charge port. Meaning for us to get those out we must lift the screen after heating it substantially. It’s very risky and leads to cracked LCDs in most cases.

We NEVER want to take advantage of anyone. We set expectations for everything. We would rather you know the entire truth before going with our service.

Now, to the battery. We buy batteries in bulk which do not come in “retail” packaging. We would have gladly given you a full refund on that item if it was not working up to our standards.

As you can see from most of our reviews, we go above and beyond for our customers. A $40 battery would not be worth losing a customer over.

I will still gladly refund the $40 if you come in and ask for Jessie.

As I appreciate the feedback I believe a 1 star review isn’t warranted in this case. We just lack the capabilities in making that specific repair cheaper.

The reality is the explanation you were given is 100% accurate because we would need to replace the screen as well which cost well over $100 just to get it to our shop.

I am happy that you were able to get it fixed elsewhere and for cheaper. We cannot speak to other repair shops capabilities, only our own.

Thanks for your consideration and please come see us for your refund.

Jessie

name: Brianna Kilow
text: I cracked and destroyed my Apple Watch and called over to this business asking for pricing. I spoke with a guy name Duncan(maybe not his name, not sure) and he gave me a price and told me it would take 5 DAYS for it to be fixed and returned back to me. I dropped my watch off on April 16th almost at closing time. It is April 30th and I still have not received my watch. I’ve called multiple times to check the status and every time they tell me it will be back in a couple of days. I called Monday and I was told he received tracking and that it’ll be here in a couple of days. I sent a friend to the place of business to get a status update and my friend was told that it shipped today ( April 30th) and will be here in a few days. So I called back up there and talked to the same guy and he told me that they received tracking information Monday but it didn’t ship until today (BS). I also made him aware that my last day in the area would be Sunday and I will need my watch before I leave, he says if it’s not here by Sunday we can ship it to you ( which I’m sure will be another week). At this point I asked to speak to the manager, he said he wasn’t in but he would call him to see if they could expedite my watch ( how do you expedite a shipment that has already been shipped) and he would get back in touch with. Oh he also mentioned that the reason why it’s taking so long is because the person they sent the watches to is backed up with orders and his shop has been closed and I said why wasn’t I told this from the beginning, I was told 5 days and he said he didn’t know that information until after my watch shipped. So yea, no watch still and it still isn’t promised to be here before I leave town. Worse experience EVER. OH NOT TO MENTION THIS IS COSTING ME $258.

resp.text: Brianna please accept our apologies on the delays in meeting those original time frames   We have seen a fast increase is Apple Watch Repair’s and working with our partners to insure delays are cut down to a minimum going forward we strive to get every device in and out in the fastest possible time . Communication is key and along with the partners we use are working on a ticketing system that will offer status update along the way we greatly appreciate your business and if there is anything you ever need please don’t hesitate to call or stop in! Stay safe and well

name: Blake Bedsole
text: Took my mother to get a new phone today as she busted her old one (motherboard and all) not really fixable; however, after getting a new phone (through a phone company) and being told the phone she picked has no screen protectors available, I quickly messaged ifixandrepair Walmart location, in hopes they would have something. Within two minutes I received a response with the product I requested and the price. Met with Tyler as I came into the store explaining we were on the search for screen protectors for which he showed us all available options and what they would look like once installed. Needless to say not only did my mom get one but so did I and we are both very pleased. I recommend anyone with phone repairs or just on the look for new accessories or gadgets visit Tyler and his team for prompt and quality service!

resp.text:
Thank you so much for your kind words, Blake. We really appreciate you taking the time out to share your experience with us — and we agree, Tyler is truly a gem to have on our team! We count ourselves lucky for customers like you. We look forward to working with you again in the future!

Have a lovely day!

name: Kayden Chapel
text:
I was out of town and my phone crashed on me. I went in to get it fixed and they said it would be a week and they would ship it to me. After 35 days and tons of phone calls to the owner my phone could not be located and all of them were caught in multiple lies. If that wasn’t bad enough they stopped answering my calls so I was left without a phone. After a month and a half I finally got my phone back and there were even more problems than when I gave it to them. NEVER TAKE YOUR PHONE HERE. The owner Tyler lied to my face and wouldn’t even give me my phone back when I asked for it 6 hours after I left it. I have never dealt with so many dishonest people at one store. Worst experience of my life. The experience was horrible, and to make it worse I got took for $200 and they refused to refund after not fixing the problems and causing more.

Response 2: I guess the “board repair time frame” covers all the lies told. Also once again another lie. Ifixit denied the charges being refunded and the credit card company had to eat them.

resp.text:
Unfortunately. The board repair time frame was out of our control . As a third party board repair team is the ones we use . While having it at board repair a charge back was placed on the payment and was sent back to you as soon as we had it back in our position . This was also handled at the end of last year as we have the charge back notice  as it was never our desire for the time frame we updated you based on the information provided by the boated repair team

Some iPhone 7 devices have many many  board level and chip level flaws that are design issues and also beyond anything that can be controlled or prevented

text: WOULD NOT RECOMMEND. Was getting an iPhone 6 repaired that had a little bit of frame damage. name: Edward Ramski
text: My wife dropped her Samsung S8+ phone and spider webbed her screen.  I had used CPR before but before the new owner bought the business about 3 years ago.  My first call was answered by the owner who quoted a (to me) reasonable price and ordered the screen (which wasn't in stock) without me having to come to the store.  I dropped the phone off the next day and the person I dealt with was very knowledgeable, answering all my questions. I was called late that afternoon but chose to wait until the next day to pick it up.  It was like a brand new phone. Wife is happy, I am happy.  Great service, friendly competent employees, and a willingness to go the little bit extra that makes for great customer service.

text: Really needed help with my cell phone. Locked myself out of my phone when I changed the PIN. Dummy.  Anyway, I called and ended up talking to the Kristie, the owner.  Called back trying to get a tech guy at the office.  My call was rolled back over to Kristie. She was going to call them herself, and I asked what time they closed, and she confirmed closing was at 8pm. I arrived at 655pm, shortly after speaking with Kristie, the owner. Regular business hours they close at 8pm.  Modified hours right now, they actually closed at 6pm. I was upset and frustrated. Couldn't believe she didn't know when her own business closed!

text: My phone had touch issues and CPR opened my device and as of right now it’s in working condition thanks to static removal. The owner Christi Russell didn’t even charge me. Love Christi for helping me

name: Brenda Abbott
text: Recommended to go here by Sprint to have a broken screen replaced.  Arrived at 4:30 pm to closed sign even though hours are posted until 6 pm.  Cristy let me in and stated they needed to order a new screen because she didn'thave the part in stock..  I was desperate so I paid half and was told it would be in Tuesday am.  Get a quote on Monday from another place for half what I was charged here.  I felt it was a lesson learned and at least I was supporting a local  business.   On Tuesday, screen has not come in.  Promises it will be there Wednesday.  When I call on Wednesday I get disconnected when I press 2 for store and pressing 3 to speak with Cristy and the mail box is full.  Cristy called me back telling me her credit card was compromised and the order was canceled.   She promises it will be in Thursday morning.  No call until Thursday  night at 5:30.  Cristy says she won't be there because it's Halloween but I can drop off my phone and pick it up if I want to come in.  Although I had plans for Halloween,  I cancel so I can get my phone  fixed.  It took longer than expected but was repaired and by looking at the reviews, I am lucky my phone  is working properly.  I was told I would receive a free screen protector but when I picked up my phone was told they didn't have any in stock.  Overall it was not a positive experience and I am pretty sure I paid a lot more than I should have.  I suggest reading the reviews and not just trusting a recommendation from a store or the star rating.  Sign in the store offers 10% off for good social media review.  I now wonder how many of these good reviews were authentic or written for a discount.

name: Jalen Man
text: They did good job

name: WE DEMBoyz
text: My daughter took my son to get his 6plus screen replaced did it quick. The service was great and professional will come again .

name: Toni Smith
text: I LOVED THE EMPLOYEES AT CELL REHAB! EVERYONE WAS SO FRIENDLY AN HELPFUL! IT DIDN’T TAKE LONG FOR THEM TO FIGURE OUT THE ISSUES I WAS HAVING WITH MY PHONE AN OFFER A ALTERNATIVE SOLUTION.  THANKS TO THE STAFF AT CELL REHAB

name: Amber Episcopo
text: I took my HTC One to Cell Phone Rehab in hopes they would be able to fix the shattered screen. No one else would work on it, however, CPR did and now it works wonderfully. They were fast, had the phone ready when promised, very easy to work with. They took the time to answer all my questions, without making me feel like I was wasting their time. I am sure you will not find better service anywhere. I highly recommend using CPR for all your phone repairs.

name: Kamaria Glover
text: The owner and technicians are amazing! They really assist you and make sure you understand everything that is going on with your phone. PLUS they use premium parts WITH a warranty. If you’re looking for a place you can trust, come here!

name: Denise Hodrick
text: Took my son's cellular phone to be looked at .Right away they said it couldn't be fixed . He had a very...... I don't feel like being bothered behavior,like I rather be doing something else besides looking at your broke phone .

name: Bri Rogers
text: Christi and her staff was Amazing. My daughter had disabled my phone and she immediately told me to come in the next day and she made my experience a whole lot better. I will recommend her and her staff to anyone. Thank you for your generosity and taking care of me . -Briuna

name: Andy Johnson
text: Took my phone in for a screen replacement in 12/23 I was assured it would be ready on 12/27. As if 12/31 they say the part hasn't arrived yet. I do not recommend .

name: Micheal Deavers
text: The staff was very helpful and professional. I couldn’t be happier with the repairs they did with my iPhone.

name: Tyler Finkelstein
text: Great experience! Was helped by Keltryn who was fast and professional. Thank you for your help. Will definitely be back if ever in need of cell phone repair.

name: Maxine Wheeler
text: They were very professional and friendly.  I bought a battery for my Galaxy Samsung S7 but didn't realize needed professional to replace battery.  I was able to leave it there for a short time and pick it up.  They had it ready at the time promised. GREAT JOB

name: gregory hines
text: Fast speedy professional service. Phone looks and operates like new. I would recommend this store to anyone. Go by and see Christi for great service and prices are great.

name: chandra mohan kurapaty
text: They fixed the phone in the timely manner, their staff discussed the issue with the phone very clearly and they didn't charged me more than what was initially quoted. Also they gave warranty for 6 months. I am totally happy with them.

name: Brian Canady
text: Always a pleasant experience with these guys. They are friendly, knowledgeable, and most importantly they stand behind their repairs. I've had two different phones worked on by them, and both times they kept me updated through the entire repair process, and when I got them back, they were good as new. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking to get their phone, computer, game system or any other electronic device repaired.

name: Miss WaConda Nolan
text: I had my light kit replaced on my IPhone 6 Plus on September 25th. This is the best place to have cracked screens in addition to any other issues your cellular phone may experience. Please inquire about this amazing light kit. Customer for Life.

name: Rick Love
text:
New name  New Management  New  professional attitude.  Nice  waiting area.  Very Clean,  Very polite  team.
Work area  is  super clean and  tech team  are the best.     When you need help,  call these folks

name: diane thomas
text: Open on Sunday's and repaired my Samsung S8 plus that was completely DEAD in less than 1 hour and Verizon told me that it would never work again

name: Dama Darby
text: This was the second glass screen I had repaired with them. The first was great.  The second they had glue oozing everywhere out of my phone. The glue to put the new glass on was not cleaned up and even was on my front camera. I don't take self-esteem but this was messed up. It was a S4. I not have upgraded to the S7 Edge. They need to be more  neater with their work. This was like a year or so ago. The people were nice and the work fast, but sloppy.

name: Jimmy Jacobs
text: Took my LG G4 in with unresponsive screen.  Analyzed and performed troubleshooting process.  While the tech was unable to find a solution, his work and manner were outstanding.  I would return to them in future with other problems and recommend the shop highly.

name: Octaviea Dean
text: This Customer Service was Absolutely amazing and it definitely took them no time at all to get my iPhone 6s Plus looking good as new!! Very much so appreciative!!

name: Shaun Padgett
text: This store is now under new ownership and new management... The location has been completely remodeled inside and out as well as stocked with all of the newest cell phone accessories available. The technician was very knowledgeable and had my phone back to me in about an hour.

name: Berkleigh Davidson
text: So amazing !

name: Wayne Cumbie
text: I would not recommend. The owner told me they had an Apple certified tech. This is untrue. I was told I needed a screen when my issue was they phone would not turn on. A new screen did not fix and was given the phone back unfixed. I sent it back to Apple who said the phone was damaged internally which left the phone beyond repair. My experience with this company is that I would not trust them with an expensive phone. The owner seemed hasty to sell screen and promised a lot. In my experience I found a young man were there that was not that knowledgeable. The owner explained her boyfriend who did most repairs was busy. Buyer beware.

name: Latranza Gordon
text: The service is great n quick. I will definitely do business with them again.

name: Minh N
text: Service was nice, fast and prices were good. The phone looked good after repair. Kristie was very nice.

name: Christopher Walker
text:
1. The place stinks like a dirty ashtray when you walk in.
2. A disheveled employee approached me--he was polite--I'll give him that
3. I asked about a new screen for my iPhone 6S+
4. He said, "Wow, those are so new and hard to get. The screen alone will cost $299.00!"
4a.--The above is NOT true--the screen even at the most expensive offering is $180.
4b.--It is NOT hard to get
4c.--If you go to a true Apple store (i.e. Summit Birmingham)--they will replace your screen while you wait for $149.00. CPR with their prices could literally take your phone to B-ham and have lunch and still earn over $200 per phone (when you include labor). Wouldn't be surprised if that is what they do. The guy that waited on me knew the price at the Apple Store when I mentioned it. That is pure speculation on my part; but, this CPR place is a mess and totally unprofessional.

My advice--take a trip to the Apple Store (get an appointment first) and the folks there will make your phone like new for $149. The money you'll save will more than pay for the trip and you'll have enough left over to enjoy a nice lunch at all the great restaurants at "The Summit."

If you MUST get your phone repaired in Montgomery--I suggest "Total Cell Phone Repair." They charge parts + $55 labor--or $235. That's still expensive; but, at least they are honest on the price of the screen. CPR charges $299 JUST FOR THE SCREEN alone--Absolute "Rip-Off" If there labor charges are the same as most--$55.00/hour--that would be $350.00 price tag!!

name: Sam Caudill
text: I got a price that was equivalent to how much it should have coated to fix my Nexus 6 properly, which ran me $290 (big phone screen and nice glass, and $20 for a warranty to fix it if the screen breaks again which they said they wouldn't do after it broke) Except the problem is that the glass they replaced is not the same kind of glass the phone comes with. The glass broke from stress in my pocket while I was at work standing (I'm a cashier), and the phone continues to crack from just being set down. Honestly they did get it fixed properly but they didn't uphold their promise to make it "good as new". They overcharge for cheap glass so you may as well not fix your screen.

name: Foxx Hound
text:
New management which has a new Professional set up. Excellent customer service. Quality work. I Highly recommend.

Mike Grissom of Capitol Hyundai

name: Tori Jackson
text: Worst experience for the last few weeks.. I was told that I would have my iPhone back within 3 days and I have been dealing with CPR for about 3 to 4 week. Within these 3 to 4 weeks I have been more than 5 times and nothing was ever complete. when I got my phone back. My center button was perminately pressed in. So I called back (this should have never happened anyways) and told the guy what was up and we discussed me coming back on Monday (my ONLY off day) and the shop NEVER OPENED. nor was there even a number to leave a message. As a customer I feel this was disrespectful. Because not once was I called this time or the Times before to be told "I'm sorry your device is not ready or, your part didn't come in" anything to prevent me from driving all the way from where I live which is not in the city of Montgomery. The amount of gas that has gone though my car just traveling back and forth to this place is unspeakable.. Because the site  never opened Monday, I took the phone to another repair place only to be told "the hole for this phone is too small. This isn't the right screen." ... So, I paid over 100 dollars to be given back a phone that isn't properly fixed. how can you give a customer back a phone that isn't properly fixed and that's the whole point of the store. I feel like that is SO shady because I did my part. There is no way this couldn't have been seen. My phone stays on voice control constantly which is SO annoying and half the time I can't even control it. I want my money back.

name: Theresa Taylor
text: Workers are good at what they do. But it really took longer than really expected to fix phone due to being sent sub par part...not their fault. But it was a very expensive fix. But the work has done well.... And have not had any issues so far.

name: Bethany Deairy
text: Christi and her tech team show exemplary service! She does everything she can to help you and has you out in a timely manner.

name: Pre'Knechia Carter-Stokes
text:
One word, unprofessional.
My girlfriend and I went into this place expecting her iPhone 6 Plus to be fixed, it ultimately wasn't. We paid $220 and I also paid a rush fee for the screen to come in next day. It did come in next day but here is where the issue came ...
They "fixed" the screen but once my girlfriend got it to the car, the screen still wasn't working. They said it was a defective screen. OK fine, they order another. They put it on and it still doesn't work. I'm just thinking at this point that they don't know what they are doing. So they refund the rush fee. My girlfriend paid CASH to them for these repairs. She requests a refund and they only give her $130 one day and they said come back. Why ? We paid you cash the first time, why would we come back. She agrees and then we come back almost 3 days later asking for the remainder of the refund. He slings open the register and says, "I only have $50 you can either take this or come back." He said it like we were inconviencing him when we gave them three days to get cash. He offers to put the rest on the card, and this was Monday. It's now Thursday and no sign of the refund in sight. Don't go here. Please go to a certified Apple Specialist.

name: De'Shun Thrasher
text: Would rate them lower if I could. Got my cracked iPhone X screen repaired and it glitched the next day. They agreed that it was a fault in the screen but never ordered a replacement. Only lied and had me coming up there about 3 times a week. Also very quick to ignore phone calls once they see you have a problem that they're trying to dodge.

name: nerilis santiago
text: I went to your store on May 11, ordered the part, paid 50% and I was told that the was supposed to come in the next week. I went back a couple of weeks  later to told that the part was not in but in a couple of days they would have the part will be in and nothing. I called on June 6th and I was told that they were going to talk to the owner about it and call me back. He did called me back and told that the part is coming in the next day. That was on June 6. I was finally able to coming on June 17th just to find out that the still didn't have the part. I contacted the owner and she proceeded to text me, so I took it as her way for me to contact her. I send her a message trying to find a solution to this situation and the owner calls me back, tells me she didn't read my message and begins to yell at me and telling me all her  personal things. I tried to sympathize with her and she continued been rude and belligerent. She never gave me the opportunity to explained myself. She asked if I wanted the cellphone repair or my money back. I told her that I wanted my money back and she hang up. I contacted the store and told them my decision just for them call 20 minutes later and telling that they ordered the part. How am I supposed to still doing business with them when the owner, as she identified herself, treated a costumer in that way.

name: Comoletha Jamison
text: The owner Christie is a life saver, we had 4 devices down all in less than 3 days, and her and her crew fixed them ALL in less than 24 hours. Thanks love and look out for my family, friends, etc.

name: Marina Z
text: Great customer service. Very fast. Decent prices. Highly reccomend.

text: Love It Everyone is nice and took great care of me and my phone. I recommend everyone who asks me if i know of a place to get my phone fixed i send them to CPR montgomery

text: The best place in town! Their technicians are certified and friendly. Can have your device repaired in less than and hour if the part is in stock or by the next day if they have to order it.

text: Courteous, knowledgeable, fixed my phone in a few short minutes.  Recommend highly!

name: Kwanesia Wright
text: Hit my phone on a chair at work and the screen goes out then black, blue, purple, green, and white. Screen is fudged...called and spoke with a representative and said I’ll be in on my lunch break. Long story short phone is working again

name: Amy Kim
text: the staff is very nice and it was ready quickly and the price was nice too

name: akersfam
text:
This business is awful and a rip off!!! Take your repair money to the Apple store or reputable shop! Overpriced, shoddy work by novices, super low quality repair parts, and their “warranty” claims are a total scam- YOU WILL pay twice to fix the unrepaired original problem!  We spent $130 on an iPad cracked screen repair.  When we received it back we had 3 new issues: off-center digitizer, inoperative digitizer and inoperative home key. Despite big talk about warranty, manager/owner Kristy blew us off on 5 separate attempts to allow them another repair opportunity, even with us having to pay again!

We paid another $100 to a reputable/professional repair shop, and repair was done flawlessly for less money. The new guy saved the home key to show us how jacked up the repair was,  and proved that the “damaged lcd” they contended was total BS (it works and looks beautiful now, and we did not replace the lcd!)

This IS NOT a reputable repair place. DO NOT trust them with anything other than a $10 phone screen protector replacement, and make them do the repair in your presence.

If this is the only scathing review here, feel free to disregard. But if this isn’t the only very poor review, then heed the warning and don’t go here. This outfit will be out of business within the year, all due to Kristy and her philosophy of ripping off and gouging hard working customers like you, and very likely worsening or ruining your expensive phone or tablet.

JM Akers

name: Donald Chavis (Bubba)
text:
Do not go between 3:30 and 5 pm. High traffic, low staff.
If Christi contacts you about purchasing your phone or equipment, make sure she knows exactly what you have. I drove there to sell my iPhone 5, after 40 mins of her testing my phone she realized it was not a 5s, my ad clearly stated my phone was a 5. I'm sorry does not replace your time or effort.
They do seem technically knowledgeable, but have not grasped the customer service aspect of the business yet.

name: Jennifer Pope
text: Fast and friendly service! I highly recommend.

name: Eden Thornton
text: Droid Moto Z Play needed new screen.  Went to pick up three different times.  Each time, there was a section of the screen that was not adhered properly.  Each time received a different excuse.  They finally fixed it and delivered it to my office on a Friday.  BTW, they put my SIM card in someone else's phone.  I had to spend an hour at Verizon having a new SIM card programmed.  Sorry Gold I-Phone 7 user, whose phone they placed my SIM card in.  It's my understanding that when we got the reprogrammed one, our old one, in your phone, quit working.  Hope you enjoyed your CPR experience as much as I did.  I gave it back to my child on Sunday evening.  He sat in the den and played on it.  By Monday evening the screen went blue / purple.  By Tuesday morning, it was solid black.  The phone is in an Otterbox with a screen protector and he literally did not leave the chair with it.  Now I am out $220 and have a phone that still does not work.

They truly know their products & programs when it comes to Apple iRipoff's (kidding, kind of) & Samsung. Repairs, sales, upgrades, etc - CPR is certified & completely competent to handle any & all of your IT needs at the most reasonable price username yet in Montgomery.

text: With trepidation I sent my iPad and Samsung cell phone in by a friend to CPR for repair expecting a costly fix and a long wait time. I usually incur long drives from the country or drive backs, long  wait times and unexpected additional cost for most everything. As promised the repairs were made promptly and inexpensively.  Moreover, everything works perfectly, was nicely cleaned and I received a new iPad holster free within an a couple hours including drive time.  Good job new management!

name: Jeff Grossman
text: Was quoted a price for my cell to sell to them since had a cracked screen etc.. But still a new galaxy 3 used 2 weeks... after beating down to almost nothing said heck with it cut him a deal to repair screen 200.00 bucks so agreed, then when asked to just transfer the minor pics etc... wanted to reduce selling price by 50%... little rude to boot.. left to think it over ( cool) off a little over the scam...Get back after removing and transfer data etc,,,. says still buy drive all the way back (Oh no money today)????? ok, be tomorrow ... drive all the way down AGAIN....OH NO MONEY TO BUY...Unreal... the young man taller guy less techno prepped was helpful and over all nice guy...derrick I think was the nut buster... other guy today cool...maybe other little one's rings..etc..mad him ill.... lol

text: Fast nice service and great customer service. The owner is wonderful!!!

name: stephen price
text: Had a fantastic experience at Cell Phone Rehab. Christy, was very helpful and explained exactly what they could do to repair my iPad and how long it would take. Everyone was so helpful and courteous and great care was taken to repair my iPad as economically as possible. Would not hesitate to recommend Cell Phone Rehab to anyone in need of help getting their phone or iPad back up and running! Hands down the best place to go! You will not be disappointed!

name: Noah Cox
text: I had to wait 4 days and go in 4 different times just to get a battery replaced. Unprofessional and inexperienced staff. In the end I had to go somewhere else to get it fixed. Don't let them touch your phone.

name: David Kryger
text: Made my iPhone brand new. Quick service at a great price.

name: Jonathan Law
text:
Absolutely horrible, shockingly bad experience. I have never in my life dealt with such an unprofessional group of people. Before I brought my phone to these people, every single thing on it worked perfectly. The only issue I had is that there was a scratch on the left side of the screen that irritated me. So I tried to do the right thing and support a local business (or at least a business in the area). On August 5, 2015, I prepaid $161.49 for a screen and service for an iPhone 6. I was told that I would be notified when the parts arrived.

Days go by, and I don't hear from them. I had to call on the 11th and finally ask what exactly was going on. They had an excuse about how their delivery of parts was delayed. Either way, they'd have it the next day. So I'm pretty understanding, and I agree that'd be fine. I take the phone in on August 12. Again, they do not call me - I had to turn up and see whether it was done. I wait approximately 10 minutes after arriving since they were apparently still working on it. Everything looked good initially when I got it back, but I started noticing problems almost right away on the phone.

There was an absolutely immense battery drain on the phone, but more importantly than even that was the ambient light sensor not working, the backlighting at the top of the phone was WAY off, (and they should have noticed that if nothing else if they repair phones for a living) and the proximity sensor wasn't working. If you don't know what a proximity sensor is, when you hold a smartphone up to your head to talk, it shuts the screen off so it doesn't register contact with the screen. It makes it very difficult to use your phone as a phone when it isn't working. The next day, on August 13, I call them back and explain the issue. They agree to take a look at it again and see if there's something they missed. I understand that sometimes, these things happen.

Can't make it there before close on August 14, but I do arrive on August 15th. Another employee looks at the phone, and says that there's just an issue with the screen at this point. They'll have to order another screen to resolve these issues. It's frustrating, but I understand, and I agree, and ask them to contact me when it is in. I waited 10 days, and heard nothing from them. Called a little late in the day on August 25th, and I was told that they got the part in either the day before or that day. So, I mean, thanks for the heads up, right? Can't make it there that day, so I take it in on August 26th.

On August 26th, I drop the phone off yet again around 12:00. The employee says they're a little backed up, but they should hopefully have it ready in about 2 1/2 hours. I told him it was fine. Close to that time later, I got a call saying the screen was on the phone, and they were going to test the other functions. Got another call later, and they told me that the screen was working fine, but that they could not get the proximity sensor to work. They claimed to have tested different parts, but they simply could not get the proximity sensor to work on the phone. I asked how we intended to resolve this issue, especially since it worked when I brought it to them.

I was told that they could either place a damaged screen on the phone (not my original screen in this case, but one that was much, much more damaged) and get a refund, or that basically, I'd have to live with it. This is literally three weeks to this point, and I absolutely need that telephone. Time I don't have it almost always translates to lost productivity. So essentially, my choice was to get my phone back in worse shape than I brought it in, and get my money back, or to keep the screen and they don't fix an issue they caused. I essentially had no real choice in the matter. I am contacting my credit card company to get my money back. They are a terrible business, and your money would be better spent anywhere else. They should be ashamed, but they're not.

name: Tyler Barranco
text: Phone didn't react to touch or swiping motion. Once I brought it to CPR it worked good as new!

According to the neighbors arou d this so call buisness they do this alot. You need people who are actually going to stay and work and focus on our phones and not be working 2 jobs at once! I recommend going to celebration in the mall by the food court. Super nice, knowledgeable, and they put 100% focus on you and your repair only.

resp.text: James, thank you for your honest review. Our employee that was supposed to be at work got sick, had to leave and we did not have anyone available to come in on short notice. The young lady you spoke to that works at Spencer's is a part time employee and was working at Spencer's but stepped over during her break to close out the day for us. name: Cliff Carlisle
text:
Eastdale Mall/ Montgomery, AL

DONT DO IT!! Horrible customer service. Terrible products (their brand) Good luck getting in touch with the manager. The reviews here must be from employees.

I had a screen break. They fixed it. Took an incredibly long time. I walked around for a little while and the guy who started fixing my phone was texting his fingers off until I interrupted him to ask if he was done with my phone (Of course not). After getting my phone back and insisting on an Otter Box the employee (Ferris) convinced me that the glass screen protector he had could break, BUT IT WOULD SAVE THE PHONE'S SCREEN. He even showed me where it saved the store's IPad. Having a thinner phone than with the Otter Box had its appeals, I even bought a minimal case to be extra sure. After a week of babying my phone, I made the mistake of bending over with it in my front pocket (3ish ft fall). Glass protector and the screen shattered. I was pretty pissed.

Went back to the store. New girl (Magen) seemed a little overwhelmed with helping other people so I was relatively nice to her. She told me that Ferris was promoted to manage his own store (watch out).I told her the story and asked for a refund of the defective glass screen and plastic case (both failed at doing their job and cost me another screen). She refused because she didn't have the authority. I asked to speak to the manager and she called him from her cell phone and walked outside (abandoned kiosk in the eastdale mall could have been costly) left me there and came back. Nope, the manager wouldn't do anything either, and I wasn't allowed to speak to him (STORE POLICY!!!!) She cut $10 off the new glass screen and gave me the managers email address.

I am only writing this after attempting to contact the manager for the past two weeks(Chris Vick) I'm normally not the kind of guy that would do this. However, this business has terrible products that promote future phone screen replacements (kind of brilliant), have terrible customer service and even worse management.

$400 taught me a valuable lesson about Cellairis...If I ever break my phone again, Ill support the Arabs a few kiosks down.

text: My LCD screen went out about two weeks ago so I got it repaired here. At first it was working fine and now there’s major glitching and typing on it own along with the bottom portion of the screen not working. Asked the girl if she could replace it again because the screen she gave me must’ve been faulty or something. She proceeded to blame me for my phone not working and said it’s because I’ve dropped it. The screen isn’t shattered and there’s no way a drop could cause malfunctioning this bad. Not to mention, the glitching and screen malfunctioning started randomly, not after a drop.

resp.text:

name: Nicole L
text: Just had a great experience - The other cellphone shop was going to charge me $30 just to diagnosis my phone so I went in with my phone to here instead. My phone was completely unusable but wanted to see if fixing the screen would help me be able to unlock it because my phone wasnt backed up- The owner fixed my screen but saw that my phone was wiped so there was no point in me trying to fix it since I just wanted the data. He charged me nothing even though he did a ton of work just to help me diagnosis it. Really fast and helpful service 100% recommend this place

name: Mike
text: My iPhone SE lost it's ability to charge with an apple lightning cable. I dropped off the phone and two hours later, the technician diagnosed the issue as a bad lightning port and ordered a new one. I returned the next day to learn a bad logic board was instead at fault. I decided not to fix it since the phone could still charge with an aftermarket cable.  After this process, he billed only for the aftermarket cable.

name: Kassiday J
text: I Spent over $130+ getting my screen fixed and purchased an otter box. After one drop my screen is shattered flashing different colors, pretty much ruined. I called to be informed there’s no warranty and it’s nothing he can do regards to the otter box not working. So please keep in mind before going here that you’re paying a lot of money for no warranty. I had to go elsewhere and pay more and was informed the screen I got originally from this place was poor quality.

resp.text:
Hey Kassiday.

I am the manager, and i told to our technician.

He will fix it for $49, which does not even cover part price.

Physical damage is very hard to control. We see customers drop and break their 5 times a month.

We also have many customers  visit us after 2 years to repair another device.

We understand your frustration but just wanted to remind that even Apple does not cover pysical damages.

name: Tyler Robins
text: Amazing customer service. I had my iPhone X screen replaced with a refurbished screen, but it had some issues initially. The first replacement had scratches under the glass which I didn’t notice until later. He replaced it for free since it was damaged. The second replacement I got worked for the majority of the time but randomly would get ghost touches, click instead of scrolling, and held down keys. It took me a little over a month to be sure it was a problem with the screen and not iOS glitching. Even though I wasn’t able to replicate the problem, he took my word for it and gave me another replacement! Just an outstanding warranty and customer service. Also, he replaced each screen in less than an hour. Not many places will do same day screen repairs like that at a price lower than Apple’s. Can not recommend enough.

name: Drews
text:
DO NOT TRUST THEM FOR BATTERY REPLACEMENTS ON IPHONES.

About a month ago, I got a battery replacement from them on my iphone, and the new one they put in was running out of battery even more than the old one--about 1% per minute--dying at 24%. So, I ran a battery testing app on it, and the replacement they installed performed WORSE than the original battery that was being replaced (the original was over 2 years old!)

So I brought it back to tell the owner, and he had the nerve to put a second garbage battery in my phone. Luckily, I looked at the battery as he was putting it in, and I saw that this "NEW" battery had the serial number literally covered up, with a black marker. I asked him why it was like that, and he stuttered and basically said nothing.

I got my money back and ordered a do-it-yourself kit from amazon, and what do ya know, the battery works great and performs really well on my testing app. These guys are scam artists and they get away with it because most people would never think to act that way.

Be very careful here, or go somewhere else.

resp.text:
Dear Zachary. Sorry for bad experience. We searched in our database we could not find any records.

Could you pls contact us at 205 887 5151

We will be happy to assist you and provide you with new Oem battery. We have warranty with every item we sell. We can contact our vendor to see what is the problem.

Note that sometimes motherboard drains battery dues to shorted caps or diodes.

We will be glad to do free diagnostic.

Please make sure this is the right location, we are located at

111 east magnolia avenue auburn al

Phone Clinic

resp.text:
Do you have any proof that it was not OEM?
We use OEM retina displays. Claim with no proof is just guess. Most probably your frame was very bent.  The main problem with iPhone 6 is that frames will bent easily after dropping it for the first time.
We do our best to fix your metal frame as much as we can but keep in mind that we are not body shop.
And if you drop it again it can break easier than before. We always reccomend hard cases for bad frame phones but customers do not listen

text: I came into this store with a broken home button on an iphone 6. He gives it back to me and tells me that there was a screw loose and that the button was off centered. He tells me for the first time at this point there was water corrosion and he dares to charge me AGAIN. why did he not tell me this in the first place? He puts a brand new button on and gives me it back. I get home and try to update my phone through my MacBook and now I get an error 23 message... I google this error message and its an issue with the HOMEBUTTON. I take it BACK to him for a third time and he then tells me I couldn't update my phone with the new button. why does this guy insist on not telling customers important information??? Also, I took it to Ifixit to see if they could fix it and when they took it apart. There were screws and a plate missing in the phone!!!! He was rude, stole my money, and didn't even put parts back in. Trust all these 1 star reviews this store is HORRIBLE!!

resp.text:
We apologize for this incidence. main problem is that some Android models do not have stable aftermarket parts as iPhones. It is not that we ordered incorrect part, we got defective screen for the first time and then we needed to ship back to our supplier to get another one. We did but got another defective.
This time we bought from another supplier and You came and picked up phone before we get the new part from another supplier.
Here we learned not to buy from a certain supplier, You wrote us negative feedback and we did the same to our supplier. :((

name: Patsy Canty
text: Paid for original iPhone 11 screen and come to find out when the new update installed my Face ID doesn’t work. Took it to the apple store and verified the screen was not original but generic 🤬. I will be reporting to Better Business!!!!!! College students beware

resp.text:
Dear customer,

I’m sorry to hear about your disappointment, we repair screens on cellular phones according to the customer’s request, we carry the OEM original led screens and the high copy screens that cost less. The OEM original copy we work with, offers you lifetime warranty from the manufacturer.

Apple stores of course know the difference since they are the only ones authorized to replace the Apple original screens and they know when you fix it somewhere else, they care about it because you didn’t fix it with them. As a retail store we put our stamp behind the screen to validate the manufacturer warranty and when Apple stores see our stamp they will tell you that it is not their screen.

Please come back to our shop and give us the opportunity to test your device and validate the warranty we offer you. This will not cost you anything and we will check the reason why your Face ID is not working properly, also we would like to know the location where your device was fixed and when it was fixed.

We like to share with you that our goal is not just to repair devices, it is to make sure you are satisfied with our service by doing it right and keep our customers happy because we care about all of you. Every day we try our best to satisfy our customers as we stand behind our repairs. As I mentioned before we will take care of your device and will make sure you have the OEM original led screen and as I said it already you don’t have to worry about it, it is under warranty and we will do our best to make you satisfied.

Please email me for future questions or concerns at Tuscaloosawireless@gmail.com

Sincerely,

Store manager, Abe.

name: Maria McBryde
text: Horrible customer service. They said they ordered a screen to repair my broken one, but on the day the screen was to arrive, they had absolutely no record of the location of the screen or even if it had been ordered. They then said it would take one more day, and when I asked the next day, they said three more days. It's been a week of "just a few more days" and still no screen. Steven M, their technician, cannot tell the location of the screen, or even if it has been ordered (even though he supposedly placed the order). Steven doesn't seem terribly concerned about checking the status until I show up in front of him. There is no response to my texts and certainly no pro-active checking on his part. Today I decided that if they cannot even tell whether a part has been ordered or where it is, then they certainly cannot be trusted to actually perform a repair. On top of that, I just realized looking at the receipt that they have listed the wrong model for my phone! I would not recommend this company at all.

resp.text:
Hello Maria,

Please allow me to apologize for the negative experiences you have encountered with our Harbert location. It is never our intention to misquote a repair time, and I am very sorry that we have fallen short of your expectations. If there is anything that we can do to improve your experience with us, our Customer Support team would love to know! At your earliest convenience, please reach out to them at (877)320-2237 Monday through Saturday 10AM to 10PM and Sunday 12PM to 8PM EST. Thank you and we look forward to hearing from you.

The guy also told me they already knew about the home button sensor issues.

resp.text: I am sorry to hear that you were not told about the labor charge for the screen repair, I will review the estimate process with our staff to make sure it is clearly explained for future customers.   We charge separate for the part and labor because for Windows Laptops the price of the part and the labor involved to replace a display varies greatly.  We require a prepayment for the part.  After the repair is complete we charge for labor based on the actual amount of time it takes for us to replace the screen.

name: Just An Old Man
text: Very clean place but the prices are new product prices for used 2 plus year old equipment. The techs are friendly and the place is clean. Nice place but I would definitely shop around. Why pay the same price on used when Bestbuy is down the street?

resp.text:
Dear Old Man,

When you buy tech at Experimax, you are buying more than just a "Device".   You are buying the best personal-tech customer service experience in Mobile, AL.  Read some of our other reviews and you can hear it straight from our customer's mouths. We specialize in all Computer, Tablet and Smart Phone technology.    We Buy and Sell, Trade and Upgrade, and can Fix ANY type of Computer, Tablet or Smart Phone Technology.  We charge a fair price for certified pre-owned Apple devices in excellent Grade A condition each including a one year warranty.  All devices come with free data migration and personal one-to-one device training and on going support.

Give us a chance and we will prove to you that it is worth every penny for the  Experimax Experience!!!

Kindest regards,

Cosmo

name: Jacqueline Brooks
text: I have an older iPhone that that was locked in recovery mode.I took it to the geeks at Best Buy .I was ignored for awhile then one of their so called Geeks ask me if he could help. I explained the situation, he was very rude , cold and really seemed to care less that I was concerned that I was about to lose all my data ,contacts and photo,s ( especially I told him my mom's pics who had passed away) . He took the phone and came back in 10 minutes and said your phone is crashed. There is no way to recover the data and he could not even restore back to factory settings so maybe I could recover some data from I cloud.I was devastated to say the least.I do not own a computer but I do have an iPad ( old too ) .I found this place and Austin was very helpful, friendly, professional and seemed to really want to help me.He tried about 4 or more times to restore my phone so I could recover my precious data. He was not giving up, he had the knowledge to see the phone had potential to restore from the computer by the way it was trying to reconnect . I recommend everyone if anyone can fix your phone this guy Austin will if possible. He was so nice and really determined to help me.The price was very reasonable and the customer service was outstanding. I will tell everyone about this place, and the geek squad is a joke.They are a bunch of young kids who are just running around with their nose up in the air like they know it all.They definetly do not know much about Apple Products and how the I cloud stores you info. You just have to know how to get it and Austin did. Thank you again Austin, you saved me.

name: Jonny Gaston - Evangelist
text:
I really was hopeful that this business would be a overall pleasant experience. Got my 2017 IPad fixed there. Customer service was great in the beginning. But then it took extra long for them to repair my iPad. Cosmo said 5 days. I still had no iPad for 12-14 days. Every time I called they gave me the “run-around”
They left some messages and they also was waiting on me to give the ok to wipe my iPad since it was disabled. However when I called because I still had no idea when I would get it back, all I got was excuses why it was my fault it had not been repaired yet.

I finally got it back when I pressed them to make it happen. And they did a good job at the repair. I might even give them another shot and change my review, but for now my experience was frustrating. All I needed them to say was “Hey , sorry that’s our fault for giving you an unrealistic timeframe for the repair, we are going to make this right!”

But all I got from them was a bit of an attitude and excuses.

I need my Mac book fixed as well. I might go else where. But I am not closed to giving them another chance. Maybe they were just having a bad day. I’m not sure. I wish my experience was better.

resp.text: I’m sorry that your experience was less than ideal and we will try to set better time expectations for you in the future.   Since the device was disabled we didn’t want to reset the device to factory without your permission since doing so deletes all the data on the device.  In hindsight, we should of gotten your permission to reset the device when you dropped it off with us.  Had we done so, the repair would of been completed much more quickly.   I hope that you do give us another chance to serve you, and I promise we will get your MacBook fixed in a timely manner.

name: John Bobbitt
text:
Called them regarding some new, and some used parts id like to sell from an aborted build, plus others besides. Told them exactly what (SPSPECIFICALLY AN INTEL PROCESSOR, expandable RAM, motherboards, lcd screen,) I had and they told me to come on. I went to probably irritating lengths to confirm that they bought these highly specific parts. In retrospect, I thought the name,odd, but after a long day didnt put the "mac" portion together....or I'd have asked SPECIFICALLY if they bought non-mac items. So,  I drove out from Theodore during rush hour....and they declined everything because it wasnt MAC (wed discussed what I had, mind you) and because they couldn't test board soldered parts.... He said that in refereme to RAM memory chips, a desktop cpu, and my 500gb hard drives...they only take solid state now, he said. And so on, and so on...

I dunno what the game they were playing was, but I think experimac owes me a half tank of gas and an appology. Take the gas from the guy's paycheck (if you're paying guys who think UPGRADABLE RAM is soldered to the board, anyway. And processors and graphics cards for that matter) for so politely convincing me to bring it all out there after being given models and brands.  Everything I could do to maintain some class before I left. Nothing worse than going out of your way to ensure its not a fruitless trip, only to get there and find some genius has given you bad info...and then instead of owning it....lying through his teeth ever so easily with a smile on his face. Aparently my cloths from a day under my cars hood, disguised my occupation as an aerospace engineer.... and I looked like someone who believed hard drives require soldering. In the parking lot now trying to figure gasoline vs. Dive distance.

RESPONSE TO BUSINESS: No, I'm passing. At this point, I believe ive done what's necessary to prevent this happening to someone else. I've made them aware. You know who screwed the pooch, you know what they did...and for that matter, the african American young man who provides the quotes (according to the Liar) knew, and yet hid in the back and let the guy I dealt with do his thing. I'm wondering if THAT is in the fact Cosmo you speak of. In which case, he didnt do anything then, so I dont believe hed do anything NOW. I dont believe your store would have poated a response at all, if not for the star by my name.

You intentionally ignored my suggestion of gas compensation, and while your words are very well put together to give the impression of being amicable....the previous young mans words were pretty enough to get me out there. Fool me once, sir....yet not twice.

A whole paragraph you've written in response that says essentially... Nothing.

2 weeks Later: See folks? Still no response... Just ran and hid. Guilty.

resp.text: We apologize that we did not make it clear over the phone that we only buy Apple products.  You should of been told this over the phone.  We want to talk with you about the experience so that we can avoid something like this happening to anyone else.  Please call us at the store 251-308-8276 and ask for Cosmo.

name: Theromiles Flowers
text:
I purchased a replacement battery for my Samsung Tab 3 tablet. I received a call on last week that it was in. Had it installed today, July 9, received a call from store that new battery was not fully charged on installation, allowed them to charge the battery for a few hours to see if fully operating, & picked up tablet but battery was not fully charged (37%). Asked about it and they told me that I was have to fully charge it myself.

I would have thought, if I purchased a new battery it would have been fully charged. If I refused this battery and they ordered another battery, it would take another week before it comes in.

This is not good business and this doesn’t seat well with me. They didn’t offered a discount for my inconvenience on a non-fully charged battery.

name: Chris Murray
text: My experience overall was great interacting with the staff there as they were very helpful and friendly. I went in to get a new antenna on my iPhone. After some quick troubleshooting they said they would be able to fix it.  I returned a couple hours later and the signal was a strong 3G, but by the time I got home  I had no tower coverage at all and it was back to the way it was before. Fortunately they do warranty the work they do for six months. I guess I’ll just have to go back in the morning  and see if anything can be done about it.

text: My experience was very inconvenient and I was dissatisfied. I dropped the phone off for repair and when I returned to pick it up the screen was not replaced properly. So, they offered to fix it and I went back to work. Returning hours later thinking the phone was repaired, I thought I may want to do a test call to someone to ensure everything was working. It wasn’t. They damaged my earpiece while replacing my screen. My phone screen is very dim now and i can get the phone to charge more than 19%. I will be contacting the corporate headquarters regarding my experience at this location.

name: Lynn Hultman
text:
I first contacted Batteries Plus because my iphone wouldn’t hold a charge.  I suspected I needed to replace it.  The representive told me they had the battery in stock and could probably replace it while I waited.  I had already had a conversation with the local Apple Store and they were not helpful at all.  So I took my phone to Batteries Plus.

The store staff were all very friendly and quite helpful.  My battery was replaced while I waited.  I also thought I had a cracked screen, but the tech told me it the screen protector that was cracked, not the screen. Rather than trying to sell me something, he told me it wasn’t that bad and should be okay.  I decided to replace it anyway, and he assisted me in finding the right product and installed it for me.

While I was waiting, I looked over the products, and saw many that would fit some future needs.   We are relatively new to Huntsville, and I’m so glad  I found this store.  I will definitely shop here again.

Without exception, all the store staff was courteous, very helpful, and professional. I really appreciated that they listened to me and solved my problem.  I never felt rushed, nor did I feel any sales pressure.  I chose the products and service.  What a refreshing experience!

name: Danielle Sinopoli
text: Really straight forward and easy process, was given a $10 off coupon for setting appt up online. They knocked out 2 phones for me in an hour and were pretty busy in the meantime. Would recommend them to anyone.

name: Brad Champion
text: I had to have the screen replaced twice. When I picked up the phone after the first replacement I noticed scratches in the glass and air bubbles underneath the glass. I mentioned it when they handed me the phone. They asked me to bring it back the next day and they would fix it. They did and the second replacement was flawless. Back to looking new.

name: Chris Ethridge
text: Had batteries plus replace the charging port on my I phone because it would not connect to my charger.  Picked up my phone after the repair and am able to charge it fine but now no sound out of the speaker and no service.  Returned to batteries plus to have it looked at and was told by the technician that they replaced the charging port again because the one they previously installed had a small tear in the ribbon cable.  I was informed that this ribbon cable tear is why the speaker and antenna were not working.  When I leave the store for the 2nd time the speaker is now working and I have several bars of service so I assume problem solved.  Over the next day I drop virtually every phone call and service is sporadic going from no service to 4 bars back to 1 bar ever few minutes.  I return to batteries plus and they take my phone back and look at it for 30 min or so and tell me there is nothing they can do to fix it.  I tell them that this problem occurred due to the repair work they performed.  The technician tells me that they could not verify the phone was working 100% prior to them working on it so there is nothing they can do to help.  They suggested I do a software update...I do it and after the update my antenna is still messed up.  I understand they couldn’t test it because it was dead and it wouldn’t take a charge.  I also understand there are unhonest people out there that would take advantage of a repair shop but that is not the case here.  I had a fully functional phone that has never given me any problems just a bad charging port.  My recommendation would be to steer clear of repairing your phone and just trash it for a new one if anything goes wrong with it.  In my case the guys at batteries plus didn’t stand behind their work and cost me $100 and lost me as a customer.  The least they could do is offer a refund since they left me with a non funtioning phone.

I took my phone in last week to get repaired. By that evening my phone screen went completely black ,and didn't turn back on. It has been 7 days and my phone keyboard types on its own and continues to shift between apps, makes calls, and taps on things without me touching it. I will not be returning to this location
Very bad service 😢

name: Caitlin Elliott
text: So, walked in and was promptly greeted. Explained that I needed my screen replaced on my iPhone. I take it out to show the guy and he presses all over it, and while he is telling me my battery is swollen and causing the screen to bend, he turns it on and my screen was split in half! I couldn't use half my screen! I work 2 blocks away and have been very careful with my phone (have had a bent-ish screen for months!) so I really don't think this happened in my pocket. I called him out on it as soon as I saw the screen and he said "Look, you can't even use the screen now". He proceeded to talk about other things with my phone and didn't address the problem of him breaking my screen. He priced a screen and battery for me, but I declined and walked out because he broke my screen and absolutely refused to acknowledge it. I went back to the office, called this place and asked to speak to the manager. He asked what was wrong and I told him about the staff breaking my screen. He reveals that the guy I'm speaking with on the phone is the one who "helped" me in the store, and said that he is the manager and owned the store. I calmly explained to him what he did and how I watched him do it right in front of my face. He REFUSED to take responsibility and tried offering a $10 discount for both screen and battery instead. I said no thanks, and to have a nice day before hanging up. I am SO upset - I ended up just buying a new phone since it was about the same cost of what he would charge for a screen and battery. Find someone honest and who knows what they are doing to fix your cell phone - not here!

Then the screen keeps scrolling on its own. They tell me to bring it in, so I do. I can't replicate the problem (because I'm not a glitch genie? What do they want?) and so they won't fix it without seeing the problem. WASTE OF MONEY AND POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! You'd be better off taking a hammer to your phone.

name: Candice P. Brownlee
text: I took my iPhone in today to have my cracked screen repaired (at the 15th Street location). The nice man that helped me told me the cost upfront ($130 + tax) and told me it would take about 30 minutes to repair. To me, this was acceptable, fair pricing and excellent timing. Imagine my surprise when he came back 10 minutes later and told me it would only be $10 and my phone was fixed!!! I couldn’t believe it! He informed me that my actual screen wasn’t cracked but that my screen protector sheet was just in bad shape. (It legit LOOKED like it had seeeeveral cracks and several shattered, busted  corners.) I say that to say this... I would’ve never known the difference! He could’ve came back to the counter and still charged me the $130 and I would’ve never known the difference & would have HAPPILY paid it. The Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa COULD HAVE taken advantage of me and again, I would have NEVER KNOWN. I think this SPEAKS VOLUMES of the integrity & honesty of Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa!!! I caught a $120 break today which was much appreciated! I would do business here 100x’s again—even *IF* I ever do have a legit busted screen. My boss recommended me to Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa and I will HIGHLY RECOMMEND them to everyone I know as well! Good people you can TRUST!!! Thank you for the 5-star service today, Phone Clinic Tuscaloosa! I appreciate you more than you know! :-)

text: These guys were super friendly and helpful. After I completely busted my phone they replaced my screen for cheaper than the two other places I asked. Then they determined that my phone's logicboard was broken and switched my battery free of charge so I could use my phone again. Great customer service and genuinely good people!

name: Julia Ruderman
text: This happened last February, but I just got around to writing a review now. I broke the LCD screen of my Samsung Galaxy 6 and brought it in to be repaired. They asked for my phone number (I clarified that they wanted the number of the phone I was leaving with them), and told me to come back in a few hours. A few hours later, I come back and they haven't done anything yet. They said they'd have to replace the frame of my phone (because it would break when they removed it) as well but they didn't have a matching gold one in stock and needed my permission to use a white frame instead. The guy said "we called you but couldn't get in touch"...well yeah, you called the phone in your hand. So whatever, I come back a few hours later and it's still not done and I have to wait another half hour. I finally get it back and the frame is extended a few millimeters from the front of my phone- hard to describe but made it more difficult to press the home button and felt very fragile. A few months later, the frame is starting to peel off and I hear a crackling noise every time I press the screen. I took it to a different phone repair place back home, where I was told the first repair was incredibly sloppy. The guy there told me the first repair hadn't even glued the frame back on and it was a miracle it hadn't fallen off yet. For less than $50 (and in under an hour), he glued it on correctly and my phone looks new (aside from the mismatched front). I'm giving 2 stars because I understand things like the mismatched frame isn't their fault, and I knew it was going to be pricey, but overall it was not a good experience at all.

resp.text: Please contact us and let us know how we can improve. Phoneclinictuscaloosa@gmail.com

I will absolutely be finding another company to repair my iPhone. That is some extremely poor customer service. I'm extremely disappointed...
